resources.item: El código de verificación que ha introducido no coincide con el código de verificación presentado en la imagen. Esto no distingue entre mayúsculas y minúsculas.
Se utiliza con el fin de verificar que se trata de un envío de formulario genuino.
Introduzca el código de seis dígitos se muestra en la imagen. No distingue entre mayúsculas y minúsculas.
Haga clic para ver la fuente RSS...

La fecha que ha elegido no es legal. Por ejemplo, usted puede haber seleccionado 30 de febrero. Por favor, asegúrese que usted proporciona una fecha válida para continuar ...

La fecha final debe ser durante o después de la fecha de inicio. Por favor, asegúrese de que sus fechas son correctas...

Opcionalmente seleccione las categorías secundarias bajo las cuales este contenido debe aparecer. Mantenga CTRL para seleccionar varias categorías.
Proporcione el nombre de la persona quien ha sugerido este contenido.
Seleccione cuáles Grupos de Miembros pueden acceder este contenido. Mantenga CTRL para seleccionar múltiples gupos. Deje en blanco para asociar con todos.
Examine y seleccione el archivo para subir.
O proporcione un enlace para una descarga externa

Viendo las Categorías del Banco de Conocimiento
Viendo la Página de Inicio de Administración

Gracias por completar su registro. El administrador ha optado por aprobar manualmente los registros. Recibirá un correo electrónico de confirmación una vez que se aprueba su cuenta.[br][br][url="Default.aspx" class="SmallTxt"]Haga clic aquí para volver al Inicio[/url]

Gracias por completar su registro. Su cuenta está activa y puede comenzar a tomar ventaja de las características disponibles para los miembros.[br][br][url="Default.aspx" class="SmallTxt"]Haga clic aquí para volver al Inicio[/url]

Gracias por completar su registro. El administrador ha pedido a todos los nuevos miembros validar su dirección de correo electrónico. Recibirá un correo electrónico automatizado en un par de minutos. Tendrá que hacer clic en el vínculo en el correo electrónico para activar plenamente su nueva cuenta. [Br] [br] Si no recibe este correo electrónico de activación dentro de un par de minutos puede [url="SendValidationCode.aspx" class="SmallTxt"]reenviar su email de validación.[/url].

Gracias por proporcionar la confirmación, su cuenta se activará.[br][br]Si no eligió iniciar sesión de forma automática o ha llegado a esta página después de actualizar su dirección de correo electrónico que tendrá que [url="Logon.aspx" class="SmallTxt"]ingresar aqui[/url].[br][br]Si ya está registrado, su nombre de usuario aparecerá en la esquina superior izquierda de la pantalla.
¡Ha fallado la Activación de la Cuenta!

Se produjo un problema con la activación de su cuenta. Podría ser que ya ha activado su cuenta, el administrador ha eliminado su cuenta o ha llegado a esta página de un correo electrónico de validación muy antiguo. Es posible que desee probar [url="SendValidationCode.aspx" class="SmallTxt"]reenviar su email de validación[/url] para asegurar que usa la dirección de email de validación correcta.
Por favor, asegúrese de completar todos los campos para completar su registro. Una vez que complete el registro puede comenzar a participar de inmediato.

Por favor, asegúrese de completar todos los campos teniendo cuidado especial en los campos de dirección de correo electrónico y contraseña. Recibirá un correo electrónico en la dirección que indique después de Registrarse. Deberá hacer clic en un enlace en el correo electrónico que usted recibirá para validar y activar su cuenta.

El administrador del foro ha decidido revisar manualmente los nuevos registros. No va a tener la capacidad de enviar o acceder a las funciones específicas hasta que el administrador haya activado su cuenta.
Se ha producido el siguiente error...
No proporcionó toda la información necesaria para completar el registro. Su "Firma para publicaciones" es el único campo opcional. El resto de los campos son obligatorios.
¡La dirección de correo electrónico ya existe!

La dirección de correo electrónico que ha proporcionado ya existe en nuestra base de datos. Si ya está registrado y desea solicitar su contraseña utilice nuestra página [url="ForgotPassword.aspx"]¿olvidó su contraseña?[/url]. De manera alternativa, puede utilizar una dirección de correo electrónico válida diferente para el registro.
El nombre de usuario que ha proporcionado ya existe en nuestra base de datos. El Nombre de Usuario debe seguir siendo único para identificar a los usuarios, proporcione una alternativa.
Nombre de usuario único usado para identificarlo en el centro de apoyo.
[b]¡Requerido![/b][br]Debe proporcionar una dirección de correo electrónico válida.
Dirección de correo electrónico única. Ésta nunca se publicará en el centro de apoyo.
[b]¡Email inválido![/b][br]La dirección de correo electrónico que nos ha facilitado no es válida.
Debe tener entre 4 y 32 caracteres, sin espacios. Sensible a mayúsculas.
Por favor, vuelva a escribir la contraseña. Se debe coincidir exactamente como la anterior.
[b]¡Los campos no coinciden![/b][br]Los campos de Contraseña no coinciden.

La dirección de correo electrónico que proporcionó no se encontró dentro de nuestra base de datos. Por favor, asegúrese de que ha proporcionado la dirección de correo electrónico correcta.[br][br][url="Default.aspx" class="SummaryTable"]Haga clic aquí para volver al índice del foro[/url].

Si ha actualizado su dirección de Email, recibirá un correo electrónico que contiene algunas instrucciones adicionales para validar su cuenta. Si no recibe este correo electrónico de activación puede solicitar ésta sea enviada a su nueva dirección de Email en cualquier momento mediante el uso de la característica[url="SendValidationCode.aspx" class="SummaryTable"]reenviar su correo electrónico de validación[/url]. [br][br]Si ha cambiado su Email su sesión también ha sido cerrada automáticamente. Tendrá que Iniciar Sesión de nuevo.

Sus cambios se han guardado correctamente.
Introduzca el texto a buscar. Compatible con expresiones regulares.

Las expresiones regulares son compatibles para ambos, la búsqueda y el reemplazo de patrones. Por ejemplo, para eliminar la mala palabra "tonto" puede usar delimitadores de palabras en una expresión regular, es decir, "\btonto\b". Esto asegura que "tonto" no sea removido de palabras tales como "tontorronas". Alternativamente, si usted no delimitadores de la palabra "tonto" será reemplazado por el patrón de sustitución en todos los casos.
Introduzca el texto para reemplazar el patrón de búsqueda.
El filtro de lenguaje fue agregado con éxito.
El filtro de lenguaje fue actualizado con éxito.
Los filtros de lenguaje seleccionados se han eliminado con éxito.
¡No se han encontrado Filtros de Lenguaje!
Introduzca el término de búsqueda para eliminar. Se admiten expresiones regulares.

Las expresiones regulares son compatibles con el patrón de búsqueda. Por ejemplo, para eliminar el término de búsqueda "el" usted debe utilizar delimitadores de palabras en la expresión regular, es decir, "\bel\b". Esto garantiza que "el" no es también removida de palabras tales como "ella" o "ellos". Alternativamente, si usted no utiliza delimitadores de la palabra "el" se reemplazará con el patrón de sustitución en todos los casos.
¡No se han encontrado Términos de Búsqueda Ignorados!
¡Se ha añadido con éxito el Término de Búsqueda Ignorado!

Los Grupos de Miembros le permiten agrupar sus miembros y el control de acceso a los contenidos y características.
Edición de un perfil de un miembro existente.
El perfil del miembro se ha actualizado correctamente.
Crear una nueva cuenta de usuario. Tendrá la opción de modificar la información del perfil, una vez creada.
La cuenta de usuario se ha creado correctamente.
Actualización de Detalles de la Cuenta
Actualización del Nombre de Usuario del Miembro
Actualización del Email Primario del Miembro
Cambiar / Reiniciar la contraseña del Miembro
Prohibir acceso al Miembro o a la Dirección IP

Seleccione el departamento principal de este miembro del Staff. El conjunto de permisos asociado a este departamento se utilizará para este miembro a menos que se anule mediante la opción de Conjunto de Permisos de Miembro a continuación.

Seleccione los departamentos adicionales para este miembro del Staff. Los departamentos se pueden utilizar para controlar los flujos de trabajo que son visibles y también para distribuir emails a los miembros correctos cuando se envía un Ticket. Mantenga CTRL para seleccionar varios departamentos.

Este miembro está a la espera de activación en el foro. Para activar correctamente a este miembro utilice el botón de Activar Cuenta opuesto. Opcionalmente puede editar el contenido de la cuenta de correo electrónico de activación que se enviará a este miembro.
El conjunto de permisos asociado a este grupo de miembros se utilizará para este miembro a menos que se anule mediante la asociación de un grupo especializado de permisos de miembro abajo.

Seleccione los grupos de miembros adicionales para este miembro. Las categorías, contenidos y fichas personalizadas asociados también con los grupos de miembros seleccionados serán visibles para este miembro. Mantenga CTRL para seleccionar varios grupos de miembros.

Opcionalmente asocie un conjunto de permisos de miembro específico a este miembro. Esto puede ser usado para controlar a nivel de miembro las características y permisos disponibles dentro de la aplicación. Se anulará cualquier otra asociación de conjuntos de permisos.
Por defecto la configuración de nivel de miembro determina este título. Esto le permite anular el título nivel de miembro para este miembro. Se presenta junto a todos los mensajes.
Imagen de Nivel de Miembro Opcional:
Opcionalmente puede subir una imagen para representar a este miembro con una foto de su perfil. Esto reemplazará la fotografía utilizada en los comentarios y en la página de perfil del miembro.

Opcionalmente puede subir una imagen para representar a los miembros de este nivel. Esto reemplazará las imágenes de nivel de miembro predeterminadas dentro de la lista de miembros y las páginas de perfil.
Eliminar Imagen de Nivel de Miembro:
Eliminar Imagen de Nivel de Miembroe
Opcionalmente puede asociar un conjunto de permisos específicos a este miembro del Staff. Esto anulará cualquier otra asociación de conjunto de permisos.

If enabled a latest additions link will be displayed within the main navigation.
If enabled a most popular link will be displayed within the main navigation.
If enabled latest articles will be displayed on the knowledge base homepage.
If enabled popular tags will be displayed on the homepage.
If enabled a resources panel containing side navigation links will be displayed on your homepage.
If enable the last 5 user submitted issues will be displayed on the homepage.
If enabled the who's on panel will be displayed on the homepage.
Show Online Members Within Who's On:
If enabled currently active members will be displayed on the homepage.
Show General Statistics within Who's On:
If enabled general application stats will be displayed homepage.
Show Latest Member within Who's On:
If enabled the newest member will be displayed homepage.
If enabled a search link will be displayed in the main navigation.
Show RSS feed for search results:
If enabled a RSS feed will be available for search results.
Limit the possible number of results returned from the search engine.
If enabled attachments (doc, pdf, rtf, xls, txt, .htm, .html) will also be searched.
If enabled content tags will also be searched.
If enabled comments will also be searched.
If enabled a list of tags will be displayed below content titles.
If enabled a link to view all tags will be displayed in the main navigation.
If enabled members can add there own personal tags to content.
If enabled a RSS feed will be available for tags.
If enabled a glossary link will be displayed in the main navigation.
If enabled a glossary widget will be displayed on the homepage.
If enabled the option to add glossary terms will be provided.
If enabled a link to the member list will be displayed in the main navigation.
If enabled search options will be displayed below the member list.
By default the members list should:
If disable access to members profiles will not be allowed.
If enable a email member link will be displayed on member profiles.
If "No" no all RSS feed links will be hidden.
Limit the possible number of results returned for RSS feeds.
If enabled users will have the option to select available skins.
If enabled users will have the option to select available languages.
Number of days to track read content:

The number of days to track read content within the database. This can be helpful to purge your database every X number of days if space is limited. Set to 0 to keep all read data and never delete for long term reporting purposes. If you delete read data some older reports may not be available.
If "No" this tab will be visible but content will not be accessible.
If enabled the [0] tab will be displayed in the resources panel on the homepage.
Select the default view for the latest [0]s panel within this tab.
If "No" the latest content module will be hidden within this tab.
Select the default view for the popular [0]s panel within this tab.
If "No" the popular content module will be hidden within this tab.
Select the default view for categories within this tab.
If "No" attempting to access categories will redirect to the login page.
If enabled the option to search categories will be available.
Show Subscribe Via Email To Category:
If enabled visitors can subscribe to category updates via email.
If enabled a RSS feed will be available for categories within this tab.
If "No" attempting to access [0]s will redirect to the login page.
If enabled the option to rate [0]s will be available.
If enabled social links will be visible.
If "No" [0] attachments will not be displayed.
If "No" [0] attachments will be displayed but not enabled.
If "No" related [0]s will not be displayed.
If "No" related [0]s will be displayed but not enabled.
If "No" related links will not be displayed.
If enabled a printable version of the article will be available.
If enabled the option to email the [0] will be available.
If enabled the option to download a PDF of [0]s will be available. Content must be valid XHTML for this feature to work correctly.
If enabled the option to receive [0] updates via email will be available.
Select the fields you would like to display alongside [0]s within this tab.
If "No" user comments will not be displayed below [0]s.
If "No" the option to mark comments as helpful will be hidden.
If enabled a RSS feed will be available for submitted comment.
If enabled the ability to comment on [0]s will be available.
If "Can Add Comments" above is set to "No" should users be prompted to login?
If enabled visitors must enter a verification code when adding comments.
If enabled the rich text editor will be available for adding comments.
If enabled the ability to edit HTML within the editor will be available.
If enabled comments will be parsed through the bad language filter.
If enabled comments will not appear until approved by a staff member.
Specify how you would like to format [0] titles. You can use the following tags to display specific data within titles: {ID}, {Title}, {Type}, {Status}, {Priority}, {Level}, {WorkFlowStep}.
Tick to copy the above title format to all other permission sets.
Copy title format to all other permission sets
Copy fields for this tab to all other permission sets
Select the default view for [0]s displayed to users.

If enabled staff members will be able to view, edit & update shared staff notes.
If enabled staff members will be able to view, edit & update personal staff notes.
If enabled a list of active staff members will be displayed within the left panel.
If enabled a collection of quick search filters will be displayed within the left panel.
If enabled staff members will have the ability to search and edit existing member profiles.
If enabled staff members will be able to add new member accounts from within the staff control panel.
The maximum space available for attachments. Set to 0 bytes to completely disable attachment uploading for this permission set.

Select the permission set to use for this department.
Private departments are never visible to users.

Determine your most active content contributors.
Check how your articles are progressing through workflow.

Here you can configure various application settings.
Customize the settings for staff members within the Staff CP.
Manage how outgoing email's are handled within SIDERARE-KB.
Manage how incoming & outgoing email's are handled within SIDERARE-KB.
Manage various registration and login settings.
Manage bad language filters. Language filters are applied to all user input.
You can use ignored search terms to remove common keywords or phrases from search submissions.
View at a glance the status of all SIDERARE-KB database tables.
Add sections to your support homepage to feature specific categories from your knowledgebase. You can add multiple categories to each section you create.
Manage the points awarded to members for contributions & actions.
Here you can configure various application wide settings.
The settings have been saved successfully.
Provide a name to identify your knowledgebase. For example your company name or site name.
You can optionally override an absolute URI here. For example http://www.domain.com/kb/
Email's sent from the application will appear to come from this address.
Select the default skin for your knowledgebase.
Select the default wrapper for your knowledgebase.
Select the default language for your knowledgebase.
Specify the default first day of the week.

Select your server time zone. For example if your server is in Boston, USA but your based in the UK you should select (-5) eastern and not (0) London. Please also indicate if daylight saving time should be enabled.
If times appear an hour out please tick to suite.
Dates will be presented in this format.
Maximum number of characters to display for each link within the breadcrumb navigation. We would suggest around 40 to 100 characters.
Maximum number of characters before username's are truncated. Truncation only occurs on strings if they could adversely effect formatting. We would suggest between 15 and 40 characters.
Maximum number of characters before titles are truncated. Truncation only occurs on strings if they could adversely effect formatting. We would suggest between 15 and 40 characters.
Maximum number of characters before long text is truncated. We would suggest between 100 and 500 characters.
Prefix used for shared cookies. This should be consistent for all InstantASP applications installed on your domain. Once set we would not suggest changing this value.
Prefix used for forum specific cookies. Once set we would not suggest changing this value.
This can slow the admin homepage as it requests latest version information from an external server. Useful if you wish to check your running the latest version of the product.
Customize the appearance of the tabstrip control. The tabstrip control is displayed at the top of every knowledgebase page.
Customize the appearance of the treeview control. The treeview control is used to display categories within tabs.
Use category names as page title:
Use content title as page title:
Include content tags within page titles:
If enabled this option will translate URLs into a search engine friendly format. For example domain.com/KnowledgebaseArticle1.aspx will be translated into domain.com/Knowledgebase/Article/1.
If enabled content titles will appear within the URL. Requires the search engine friendly URLs option is enabled above.
Specify the comment threshold content must meet in order to be flagged as hot within the knowledgebase.
Mark tags as hot after they appear:
Specify the number of times a tag should appear before it's flagged as a popular tag.
Mark a comment as hot after it's been flagged as helpful:
Specify the number of times a user submitted comment must be marked as helpful before it's flagged as hot within the knowledgebase.
Provide the path to save images uploaded within the WYSIWYG editor. Enter the relative path from the application root. For example Uploads\Images.
Provide the path to save media files uploaded within the WYSIWYG editor. Enter the relative path from the application root. For example Uploads\Media.
Provide the path to save profile photographs. Enter the relative path from the application root. For example Uploads\Photos.
Provide the path to save custom task files. Enter the relative path from the application root. For example Uploads\Tasks.

Select where you would like to save attachments. Storing attachments in the database makes back-ups easier and also allows you to optionally search certain attachment types. If database space is limited you can choose to store attachments on the file system within the directory set below.
If attachments are saved to the file system provide the relative path from the application root to the attachments directory. For example Uploads\Attachments.
If you select a full-text search type please ensure you've read the instructions within the SQL Server full-text search section within the user guide.

Requires full-text search is enabled within the above drop down list and To Database is selected for the Save Attachments option above. SIDERARE-KB supports the HTML, Text & Office IFilters built directly into SQL Server to index & search .txt, .doc, .rtf, .html, .htm or .xls attachments. Older versions of SQL Server may require 3rd party IFilters before this option will function. To search PDF attachments you'll need an additional IFilter. Please consult our documentation for further information.

Specify the maximum number of rank blocks for member levels. These are the ghosted knocked back block graphics that appear next to each post. You can define the actual member levels from the Manage Member Levels page.
Specify how many previous years should be displayed within the date of birth selection.
Mark content as new if created within:
The number of days content will be flagged as new after it's created.
The number of days content will be flagged as updated after it's been modified.
Mark content as updated if modified within:
Provide a comma delimited list of image file types that are permitted when uploading images within the WYSIWYG editor.
Provide a comma delimited list of media file types that are permitted when uploading images within the WYSIWYG editor.
Provide a comma delimited list of image file types that are permitted when uploading member level images or profile photos.
Provide the maximum dimensions for profile photographs. Images uploaded that exceed this size will automatically be downsized.
Provide the maximum dimensions for custom member level images. Images uploaded that exceed this size will automatically be downsized.
If 'No' e-mail's will not be sent. They will still be queued within the database and will be sent when enabled.
Specify if mail should be sent as Plaintext or in HTML format.
Enter the address of the SMTP Server for sending application generated email's. For example mail.mydomain.com or localhost.
If your mail server requires authentication enter your username here. Leave blank if your mail does not require authentication.
If your mail server requires authentication enter your password here. Leave blank if your mail does not require authentication.
Specify the SMTP port for mail server. This is typically port 25.

Specify the maximum number of e-mail's that will be sent each time the queue is polled. E-mail's are currently polled every [0] seconds. This interval can be changed within the web.config file. We suggest a setting of around 30-60 e-mail's per minute to minimize server load.

Specify the maximum number of times failed email's should attempt to send before they are permanently removed from the queue. Enter 0 to disable. If disabled failed e-mails will be remain in the queue and the forum will continue to try and send them until successful.
Specify the character encoding to use for your RSS Feeds. This is typically UTF-8 or ISO-8859-1 for English character sets.
Specify how long RSS feeds should be cached. This will send back a HTTP status 304 ("not modified" status) to the client when the feed is requested during the cache period.
If "No" all registration links will be hidden. Useful if you handle registration within a parent web application.
If enabled users must indicate they agree to abide by your terms and conditions. You can edit the terms and conditions text within the resource.xml file in the globalization directory.
Helps prevent automated form submissions. If enabled users will be required to enter a code presented within an image during registration.

Confirmation Email will place new members into the awaiting approval member group until they click a unique link within a confirmation email. Once the link is clicked they will be moved to the registered member group set below. Admin Approval will require an admin to manually approve all new members, Automated will immediately move new members into the registered member group set below no email confirmation will be required.

This will act as the primary member group for all members awaiting account confirmation. For example, if you've selected the confirmation email registration type above members who are not validated will be placed in this member group immediately after registration. Similar if you select the Admin Approval registration type new members will be placed into this group until approved by an administrator.

This will act as the primary member group for all validated members. For example, once members have clicked the validation link within the confirmation email or you have selected automated registrations above.
If "No" all login links will be hidden. Useful if you handle authentication within a parent web application.
Specify if members should login using the account username or account email address.
If 'Yes' an option will be provided to login anonymously on the login page. Members who login anonymously will not appear within the who's on list or within forum activity panel.

Set the default path to the landing page upon a successful login. This is typically the forum homepage however this can be changed for example to point to your main web sites homepage. Any valid virtual or absolute URL is accepted.
Set the default path to the landing page upon a member logging out. Any valid virtual or absolute URL is accepted.

Specify how often the last login date should be updated for members. We would suggest the default of around 20 minutes however if your typical visitor session lasts longer than this you can increase this value.

Require confirmation if members update their email address. If 'Yes' members who change their email address will be sent a confirmation link to the new email address and placed back into the awaiting activation member group set above. Once they click a link within the confirmation they will be placed into the registered member group again

Add a new rule to help manage & route [0]s.
Escalation rules will be applied to [0] marked as overdue.
Provide a name to help identify this rule.
Select when this rule should be excluded. For example you may only wish to run this rule when clients create new items.
Only run this rule if the subject contains the supplied keywords. Separate multiple keywords with commas. Leave blank disable this filter.
Only run this rule if the body contains the supplied keywords. Separate multiple keywords with commas. Leave blank disable this filter.
Only run this rule if directed towards the selected departments. Leave blank to skip department filter.
Only run this rule if the username contains the supplied keywords. Separate multiple keywords with commas. Leave blank disable this filter.
Only run this rule if the email address contains the supplied keywords. Separate multiple keywords with commas. Leave blank disable this filter.
Only run this rule if the [0] author belongs to the selected SLA plan. Leave blank to disable the SLA filter.
Assign [0] to the selected staff member.
Useful if you wish to escalate issues.

Move [0] to the following work flow step. Any change actions & notifications you have defined at this work flow step will be applied. This will override any workflow step selected by your staff members.
Move [0]s to a specific category to help organize items. This action will override any custom workflow step change actions you may have defined.
Move [0]s to a specific status. This action will override any custom workflow step change actions you may have defined.
Move [0]s to a specific priority. This action will override any custom workflow step change actions you may have defined.
Move [0] to a specific department. This action will override any custom workflow step change actions you may have defined.
Tick to optionally send an email.

Separate multiple email addresses with a semi-colon (;). You can use the following quick tags also [ToEmail], [AuthorEmail], [ModifiedEmail], [AssignedEmail]. For example "you@domain.com; [AssignedEmail]".
Tag tickets matching this rule with the following image.

Hi,[BR][BR]The rule "[RuleName]" defined within [ApplicationRL] has been triggered. You are receiving this email because the administrator has included your email address within the distribution list. You can view the item that triggered this rule at the link below[BR][BR][TicketURL][BR][BR]Thanks,[BR][BR][ApplicationName][BR][ApplicationURL]
Edit an existing rule that will be applied to user submitted content.
Edit an existing escalation rule that will be applied to overdue items.
Provide a title to identify this status.
Provide a optional icon to represent this status.
Select a optional foreground color for the status text.
Select a optional background color for the status text.
Public statuses are visible to all within the support center. Private statuses are only visible to staff members.
Tick here to remove any existing image.
Provide a name to identify this SLA.
The duration in hours for when clients can expect a response. Leave 0 to disable average response time.
The duration before items will be marked as overdue if they have not received a staff response. Leave 0 to disable.

Items allocated to this department will automatically use this SLA. Assigning a SLA to a specific department will override any SLA you have associated with a users permission set. This is helpful if you wish to always use the same SLA for a specific department or if you want to use multiple SLAs for several different departments.

Items within any selected status will automatically use this SLA. As items are updated you can update the SLA automatically based on the status of an issue. For example items with a status of "New Issue" may require a response within 24 hours whilst items within a status of "Escalated" may require a response time of 2 hours.

Items within any selected priority will automatically use this SLA. As items are updated you can update the SLA automatically based on the priority of an issue. For example items with a "High" priority may require a response within 2 hours whilst items within a "Low" priority may require a response within 24 hours.

Create your own custom knowledgebase, troubleshooter or download tabs.
Update the details for this custom tab.
Select the type depending on how you want this tab to behave. Once saved you can select a custom field template to use for data entry within this tab.
Provide an optional short description to identify the content within this tab. For example Article, Bug, Feature, Task, Project, Guide, Download etc.
Select an optional icon to represent this tab.

Enter the text that should appear as the link within this tab.

If you wish to localize the text displayed for this tab based on the current selected language enter the key used to identify the string within the resources.xml file.

You can upload an optional image icon to visually represent this tab. This image will be aligned left of the tab text.
Select the default field template for data entry within this tab.

This will display a re-sizable splitter bar between the treeview control on the left and content area on the right. This will also immediately display an article when clicking a category as opposed to showing multiple articles within a category. You can use this option with our "Documentation" skin to provide a MSDN style layout.

This will display a list of suggested articles from within your knowledgebase, troubleshooter & download tabs based on the keywords typed by users as they complete the form for this tab within your front-end support center. This can be helpful to suggest content to users submitting tickets or asking questions within a tab.
Or simply redirect this tab to a specific URL:

If you would like this tab to simply act as a redirect to another page please enter the absolute or relative URL you would like to use here. For example you may wish to create a new tab to link back to other areas within your site.

Select which member groups can view this tab. Members who don't belong to any of the selected groups will not see this tab and will not be able to access or search any content within this tab. Hold CTRL to select multiple member groups. Leave blank to hide this tab from all member groups.
This tab has been saved successfully. The tab will now be visible to all the member groups you selected.
You must provide some text to be displayed for this tab.
You must specify a tab type or redirect URL for this tab.

Create custom workflows to configure content approval or ticket resolution processes. Each workflow you create can have a series of steps. These steps represent each stage in your process for content approval or ticket resolution. Within each workflow step you can configure automatic changes for form fields, send email notifications or configure the fields available when editing a ticket or article.
The workflow has been created successfully.
Select the departments which can access this workflow or create and customize workflow steps.
The workflow has been updated successfully.
The tab this workflow can be used within.
Provide a name to identify this workflow.
Provide an optional description to further describe the purpose of this workflow.
Select which staff departments can view this workflow. Hold CTRL to select multiple departments. Leave blank to associate with all.
Create a new workflow step for your workflow.
Your workflow step has been created successfully.
Customize this workflow step to perform specific actions when a item is moved to this stage.
The workflow step was updated successfully.
Select the staff members who can edit content in this workflow step. Leave blank to allow all:
Select a optional custom form to use at this workflow step. This allows you to customize the fields available when editing content within this workflow step.
Determines if the item moved into this workflow step is flagged as closed / complete.
Select the staff members to notify when items are moved to this workflow step:
Restrict the next available workflow steps:
Provide the absolute URL to your ASPX page with custom code. You can optionally pass in the current workflow step i.e. http://domain.com/Script.aspx?WorkFlowStepID={WorkFlowStepID}
Tick to delete items when they reach this workflow step.
Tick to archive items when they reach this workflow step.
The workflow this step is associated with.
Provide a name to identify this workflow step.
Skins allow you to customize the look and feel of your support center.
Wrappers allow you to quickly and easily wrap HTML or client-side JavaScript around your support center.
Create a new wrapper to wrap HTML or client-side JavaScript around your support center.
Here you can view all outgoing email that is waiting to be sent within the queue.
Incoming mail queues allow you monitor a specific email accounts for SIDERARE-KB tickets.
Scheduled tasks allow you define custom scripts that can be run at specific intervals.

Here you can see a log of all executed scheduled tasks.
Here you view quick system statistics that can be used to help diagnose any problems.
Here you can view the status of all SIDERARE-KB database tables.
